title: Teen killed in shooting near University of Cincinnati
content:
CINCINNATI —
A 17-year-old boy is dead following a Monday evening shooting near the University of Cincinnati.
The shooting was reported around 6:45 p.m. in the 2800 block of Vine Street near Daniels Street in Corryville. The University of Cincinnati's main campus is just two blocks west.
Officials have identified the shooting victim as Clarence Gatewood. The teen was taken to University of Cincinnati Medical Center, where he later died from his wounds.
Detectives have not specified what they believe led to the shooting, but said several witnesses are cooperating. Police also said they are utilizing surveillance cameras from nearby businesses in their investigation.
Officials said they are searching for one person in connection with the shooting, but have not provided a description.
Because of the shooting’s proximity to campus, university officials sent out an alert to students.
The university was particularly crowded Monday night as over 5,800 fans packed the nearby Fifth Third Arena for a men’s basketball game.
Anyone with information on the shooting is asked to contact Cincinnati police.
